summary: This is a protective order issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The order establishes strict rules governing the handling, use, and disclosure of sensitive discovery materials produced by the government, including confidential witness/victim information and highly confidential sexualized images.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for whom this protective order is issued, governing the handling of discovery materials.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this protective order.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues a protective order in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell to govern the handling of sensitive discovery materials.

keyFacts: The government's discovery materials include 'Highly Confidential Information' containing nude, partially-nude, or otherwise sexualized images, videos, or depictions of individuals.
The protective order strictly limits who can access discovery, how it can be used (solely for defense of the criminal case), and prohibits public disclosure of victim and witness identities.
The order reveals the government's ongoing investigation could be impeded by premature disclosure of the materials.
The defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell, is to review certain sensitive materials only in the presence of her defense counsel or via secure electronic access provided by the Bureau of Prisons.
